campaign.story:
What is Angelarium?
The Angelarium is a place where experiences, ideas and archetypes exist as real living entities. It's the domain of angels and emanations. Growing at its center sits the Tree of Life, a physical manifestation that reflects the whole of existence.
Meet the Angels
Cross Promotion with Pete Mohrbacher
Support Pete Mohrbacher's campaign to create an Angelarium art book in addition to this project to get a free bonus print of Matariel, Angel of Rain. (Must back both campaigns at $25 or more)*
*$25 before any shipping applied.
Want these cool add-ons? Just add the appropriate amount to your pledge, and we'll ask you which one you would like after the campaign!
You may have seen our work on Breaking Bad, Ghostbusters, The Goonies, The Princess Bride, Dragon Tome, Synthesis, The White Rabbit, or The Call of Cthulhu decks that we've done. We are extremely fortunate to have the opportunity to work with Pete so that we can bring another quality product to Kickstarter.
 There are two things that backers have asked us for: a project that is unique and a project that can be backed internationally.
Angelarium is the perfect project to satisfy both of those requests. Instead of just producing a deck of cards on this one, we wanted the opportunity to create works of art fueled by Pete's amazing vision.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with every project, we run the risk of natural disasters and other cataclysmic events interfering with manufacturing and shipping schedules. 

Having run a few successful Kickstarters previously, we've gotten a pretty good process down for handling pledges, shipping, and fulfillment. We can't promise that there won't be any mistakes, but we've worked very hard to make sure that there won't be many.

This project has very few deliverables and we are using our fastest and most reliable vendors. This gives us an excellent idea about their accuracy in costs and turnaround time so that we have been able to plan accordingly. The exception to this is the vendor for the playmats which we have never worked with before, but Pete has and could recommend them.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We thought that since you backed our first Angelarium project a couple years ago that you might be interested in a new one we have running right now.
If you’ve followed Pete at all, you’ve probably seen that he's a machine when it comes to making new content. After a few years, he has categorized all of his creations in a different way than how the original decks were designed. We worked with him to make a set that reflected those changes and injected some new elements so that it was still familiar, but would stand on its own as Pete continues to build the Angelarium mythos.

GREMLINS
We are happy to announce our next big project on Kickstarter: officially licensed Gremlins Playing Cards.
The artwork for this one was done by Nat Iwata and we couldn’t be happier with the way that it turned out. If you remember the movies, this deck captures them perfectly.
If you loved Gremlins, back the Kickstarter project today!

campaign.story:
Pre-order Available at: www.nataliasilva.net
Thank you so much for taking the time to visit my project. I am Natalia Silva the designer and artist behind “Love is ...” playing cards. I am excited to share my art with you, and I hope that with your support, we can make this deck a reality. 
This is my 2d Kickstarter project. My 1st "Russian Folk Art" Playing Cards campaign was successfully funded and printed with USPCC (available at: www.nataliasilva.net)
ABOUT THIS DECK:
"Love is ..." is a beautiful, simple and fun deck of playing cards inspired by love. Each card has it's own unique design and quote about love.
"What is love?" was the most searched phrase on Google in 2012.
 “What is love?” It is one of the most difficult questions for the mankind.
What is love? How do you know if you’re actually in love? Is there a way to measure love? What does love mean?
Everyone has different opinions on love. Poets and authors have tried to define love for centuries, but nobody can really know for sure. Love means different things to different people. 
So, here is "What is love?” in my opinion:
Uncut Sheets
The front side of "Love is ..." uncut sheet (frame not included).
Sheet dimensions (paper): approx. 510mm x 750mm, 20" x 29.5" (frame not included).
"Love is ..." tuck case.

 STRETCH GOALS:
This deck will be printed at the highest quality by MPC on 310gsm French casino quality card stock with black core (linen finish), unless we could reach our Stretch Goal ($10,000), which will allow me to print with the USPCC (United States Playing Card Company) on magnificent Bicycle card stock. In this case, the run will be 2500 decks.
Your support of this Kickstarter campaign will help me cover the costs of setup fees, proof charges, printing, photography, and the time to create the 54 original pieces of art. 
My goal is to create decks that are playable, unique, and valuable.
I hope you can back me and help me realize my goal!
Thank you so much! :)
ADD - ONS:
These Add-ons can be added to any backer level. 
To add on a product, keep your pledge level the same, and simply add the amount listed below to your pledge amount. You will receive a survey at the end of this campaign so that you can detail what your pledge was for, and you will receive any extra items that you want.
Thank you!  
If you missed my "Russian Folk Art" Project: it is available at www.nataliasilva.net

campaign.story:
STRETCH GOALS

Photo Credit: Anthony Ingrassia
Gambler’s Warehouse welcomes the return of renowned cardist John Powell, who invites you to make room in your collection for Regal: tradition with a lavish twist.
Combining robust design elements with a fresh take on classical styling, Regal invites you to sit among the royal. Have your pick of Regal’s four (4) fancy color themes (one color to a deck): red, purple, blue, or green.
“I was really influenced by the classic standard English courts, but I wanted to do them in a cleaner, more sophisticated and regal appearance—hence the name.”
—John Powell, designer of Regal
John Powell has become a Gambler’s Warehouse mainstay with a number of top-selling custom decks already to his credit, including the sinister Double Black and the stunning Occults.
Regal playing cards are unmistakably unique yet practical and familiar—a must for any serious collector.
Each deck of Gambler’s Warehouse Regal playing cards includes:
Custom Face Cards, Court Cards, Jokers, and Tuck-Box
Printed Inner Tuck Design
Printing by EPCC
METALLIC GOLD INKS ON CARDS & TUCK BOXES
REGAL RED
The Heart of Regal Playing Cards
Red is the color of fire and blood, so it is associated with energy, war, danger, strength, power, determination as well as passion, desire, and love. In heraldry, red is used to indicate courage. It is a color found in many national flags. It's richness and connections to romance love and rage that were in every Regal house throughout the ages.
REGAL BLUE
A Reflection of the Sea and Sky
Blue is the color of the sky and sea. It is often associated with depth and stability. It symbolizes trust, loyalty, wisdom, confidence, intelligence, faith, truth, and heaven its close association with royalty and the royal family, blue blood and such was an easy and obvious choice to make when selecting for our Regal deck palette.
REGAL GREEN
Power in the Form of a Deck
Green is the first color I began to design the deck with it immediately had a tie in my mind with the Regal family. Green is commonly associated with money and wealth. Money = Power. Power over everything has always been a hallmark of nearly every Regal monarchy known to man. It seemed like the easiest decision to make for me.
REGAL PURPLE
The Epitome of Luxury and Extravagance 
Purple combines the stability of blue and the energy of red. Purple is associated with royalty. It symbolizes power, nobility, luxury, and ambition. It conveys wealth and extravagance. Purple is associated with wisdom, dignity, independence, creativity, mystery, and magic all of which were the foundations we based the Regal deck off of.
REGAL ACES
REGAL DUO SETS
Regal decks are available in single decks or specially priced as sets of two. Available in traditional red and blue or specialty green and purple colors.
CARDISTRY AND FANNING
UNCUT SHEETS
The most excellent way to show off your Regal Collection. Available as individual sheets or in a set. Limited quantities available so get your pledge in fast!
CUSTOM BRICK BOX
Your purchase of a Regal Brick (Three Full sets of Regal Decks) Will come delivered to you in this specially designed, custom Regal Brick Box!
This box is also available as an add-on to your existing pledge for just:
$10 US / $13 CAN / $15 Rest of World
(Add-on does not include decks inside -- Box only)
REGAL POKER SET
REGAL Collector's Poker Set: Receive one Luxurious Poker Set, made from rare exotic imported Rosewood with detailed engraving. Complete with 100 professional casino quality REGAL custom ceramic chips & Any 2 REGAL Decks...
You may select this tier option or add-on to your existing pledge :)
US $175 / $195 CAN / $205 Rest of World
REGAL 4 CHIP SET
Receive 4 Custom designed REGAL ceramic poker chips
Add on US $15 / CAN $18 / $20 Rest of World
REGAL COINS / LIMITED to 100 OF EACH
These coins are available in pairs of 2 or in sets of 4. Pricing is as follows:
FULL SET: $30 US / $34 CAN / $36 Rest of World -- includes shipping
PAIR: $18 US / $20 CAN / $22 Rest of World -- includes shipping
You may begin adding these onto your pledge at any time.
REGAL Mini-Decks Add-on
Single Mini Deck: $6 US / $7 Canada / $8 Rest of World
All 4 Mini Decks: $20 US / $23 Canada / $ 26 Rest of World
REGAL T-SHIRT
Our t-shirts are made from a super soft cotton blend and will feature the REGAL Ace of Spade design on the front. Available in unisex sizes SM-XL
Get your REGAL t-shirt NOW for just $20 US / $23 CAN / $25 Rest of World (shipping included in pricing) -- simply add-on to your existing pledge!
ADD ON DECKS
Easily add decks on to your existing pledge using the deck chart below. Decks can be added individually or in sets or bricks! You choose your colors! Shipping is included in pricing and all prices are USD.
How to Add-On to Your Pledge

"No.17 Playing Cards" is a custom designed deck of playing cards (poker size), printed by United States Playing Card Company (USPCC), Bicycle® branded.
There is no specific theme in this deck, it´s quite eclectic and I let my fantasy run when I illustrated the courts. The diamonds have clearly an Egyptian resemblance, but overall they belong to a parallel world. There is a thing that connects all the court cards: the text circling the background is a part of the Aeneid, a Latin epic poem written by Virgil between 29 and 19 BC, that tells the legendary story of Aeneas, a Trojan who traveled to Italy, where he became the ancestor of the Romans. 
I am Lorenzo, I live and work in Stockholm, Sweden. I design custom playing cards and Stockholm17 is the name I use for projects.
This is my 3rd Kickstarter campaign for custom playing cards, feel free to take a look at Requiem Playing Cards and Heretic Playing Cards (both successfully funded and fulfilled).
Designing and illustrating playing cards is my passion. I hope you like this deck and that you want to support it by backing and sharing this campaign :)
No.17 Bicycle® Branded Playing Cards
No.17 "unbranded" Playing Cards 
Sterling Silver Ace of Spades 
2 decks for this campaign. The faces are the same for both, however, the backs and the tuck-cases are different.
And a beautiful 100% Sterling Silver Ace of Spades that works as a pendant, a poker card holder, or a key chain.

The Bicycle® branded version has a cherry red back. The unbranded version has a back in beige/white with red accents.

The back of both tuck-boxes - side by side
What is the add-on and how does it work?
Basically you are in a reward, but you want to add something (decks or other items). 
Example:
You chose the 6 deck reward and want to add two more decks. Just look at the price list table (scroll down), see how much Viking money you need to add, do some simple math, and update your pledge (instructions are farther down).
BUT,
if you are in the 4 deck reward, and you want 2 more decks, please move in the 6 deck reward.
100% Sterling Silver Ace of Spades (add-on or reward)
100% Sterling Silver interpretation of the Ace of Spades. Made to scale, this object of beauty lifts the lines of the art work into the three dimensional world and into the palm of your hand. Finished with a highly polished face, offset by an oxidized background to capture the depth and layers of the artist's original. Total weight in sterling silver is 26.5 grams ( 0.93oz). campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The deck will be printed by USPCC (United States Playing Card Co). 

The estimated delivery date is just that, an estimate. it depends on USPCC and their workload. I will send the final files at the conclusion of the campaign, but I cannot speed up the production. There is a possibility of earlier delivery, but it all depends on how quickly USPCC completes the production.

Printing a deck of playing cards is a standard procedure, but errors may occur, you never know, the devil is in the details. But this is my third project and I do not foresee any issues. I'll keep my eyes open and follow every single step of the project to make it real, as I did for Requiem Playing Cards and Heretic Playing Cards.

Be aware that the colors on the screen will not perfectly match with the colors on printed paper. Graphics may improve or change slightly in the final printed version.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Patriot Playing Cards and the Patriot sculpture were made in remembrance of the American Colonials who believed in the ideals of the American Founding Fathers, and became a free people through their own personal sacrifice. They risked it all to leave a legacy of freedom to their families and to those who they would never know.
Each individual card was custom made, by the renowned artist Mark Aro,  to reflect the artistic style of 1776. Thick lines, a weathered look, high grade linen textured paper and a simple yet striking design makes these cards the perfect gift for patriots, conservatives and liberals alike.
In our deck are many great quotes by the Founding Fathers, this is one of them: "When the government fears the people, it is liberty. When the people fear the government, it is tyranny." -- Thomas Paine
The message they fought and died for got through and was penned in the Constitution, "We the people"! 
You are on the front lines of the political battles of today.  Help us get the message through. Please pledge today and we can remind America of the words of the Founding Fathers.
We are also including this limited edition, custom made wooden box, check out how to get it our pledge section!
 The Patriot Logo and shirts were designed by Sean Pringle of 556 Graphx, tactical industry design.
The Patriot Logo sticker. 
 The White Shirt with Red Logo.
The Black Shirt with full color logo.
$14k Milestone Reward - Patriot Playing Card Shirts
These high quality shirts have one of the 4 card symbols in the front and a dedication to Patriotism in the back.
FREEDOM'S FORGE
"Freedom's Forge" is meant to instill a sense of life, liberty, justice and freedom in the individual. History has shown, vis-à-vis the rise and fall of nations comprised of a collection of individuals, that our natural being demands these rights, and when we deviate from them we suffer. Thus, in order to retain life, liberty, justice and freedom, the individual must be the forge from which those ideals are realized. -- McCormack (he bought the statue and got to choose the name)
This hand sculpted Patriot was commissioned by "Stone" to represent the American "Spirit of Liberty" and the values that made America great.
This is a patriot, in battle, running to the front lines, carrying the American Flag in his left hand and a musket in his right hand. There is also a musket across his back and 2 hatchets strapped to his waist.
* Del Parson's "Old Man Wept" used by permission
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges

Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Backers!
We are back on Kickstarter for a 3rd time. We wanted to invite you to check out our new campaign Conflicted: Survive the Apocalypse. This is a board game about surviving the apocalypse. 
The world is ending and your survival depends on your strategic thinking, cunning, negotiation skills, but most importantly your sense of humor.

Hello fellow patriots! With Black Friday right around the corner we wanted to offer our backers some great deals on our patriot gear.  We have a limited amount of new items that might catch your interest.

We started shipping the decks, have you received yours yet?
The folks who have the wooden box need to wait just a little longer.
Have you received yours yet? Let us know! 
Thanks for your patience,

Because we hit our goal, we gave the option of the tuck box versus the plastic box.  We had a lot of people who would like the tuck box.  So if you DO NOT want a tuck box and would prefer the plastic box, please respond to this update or email us at patriotcarddecks@gmail.com
Thank you for your support!

Hello folks!
I'd like to thank everyone who believed in our project! We are excited to get this out there and to get people talking and thinking about the principals that made America a country millions immigrated to when there was nothing but an opportunity to be whoever they wanted to be.
Over the next few days we will send out a survey, asking some more details about your reward (what color decks, plastic or paper tuck box case, who would you like us to send a deck to in the government, shirt sizes etc) and then we expect to ship everything by the end of May.

"Freedom's Forge" is meant to instill a sense of life, liberty, justice and freedom in the individual. History has shown, vis-à-vis the rise and fall of nations comprised of a collection of individuals, that our natural being demands these rights, and when we deviate from them we suffer. Thus, in order to retain life, liberty, justice and freedom, the individual must be the forge from which those ideals are realized.
McCormack has purchased the original statue and chose the name "Freedom's Forge". His reasoning for choosing this name is above. We could not have asked for a better name! This name will help remind us that freedom is forged by the men and women who will stand up for the values and liberty that our Founding Father's understood.

campaign.story:
The last half of the 18th century was littered with minds that immeasurably stood out from the rest, inventors and innovators that supercharged society to new heights launching mankind into the new century. Represented here are the royalty of Innovation, categorized into four suits: Illumination, Transportation, Communication, and Aviation. 
“Innovators change things. They take new ideas, sometimes their own, sometimes other people’s, and develop and promote those ideas until they become an accepted part of daily life.” --thehenryford.org
I watched a documentary on the History channel called, "The Men Who Built America". In that documentary the stories of John D. Rockefeller, Cornelius Vanderbilt, Andrew Carnegie, Henry Ford and J.P. Morgan were told. I was glued to the TV...I was hooked. Their stories were inspiring and I was struck by the spirit and ingenuity they showed. I decided that I should do a series of playing cards that celebrated the spirit that these kind of men and women demonstrated. The Inventors series was born.
I hope you will allow me to tell you the stories about these men and women through playing cards. Along with a fully custom illustrated deck of playing cards there will be a booklet that gives a little story to each character. This will be the first deck in the inventors series. I hope their stories will be an inspiration to you as well.
Features:
Printed by the Legends Playing Card Co.
54 Custom Cards. Each court, Ace and Joker cards will have original illustrations, capturing the feel of the era. 
The Cards will be printed on the "Legends" Classic Finish, which is the highest quality card stock.
Premium Matte Card Stock Box 
Unique Back Design
Features:
Printed by the Legends Playing Card Company 
Each court card, Ace and Jokers will have original illustrations, capturing the feel of the era. 
The Cards will be printed on the "Legends" Classic Finish, which is the highest quality card stock and have Gold foil embossing and Gold metallic ink
The Tuck Case will be made with Premium Matte Card Stock Box, fully embossed and foiled, combined with Gold Metallic Ink
Unique Back Design

Printed by the Legends Playing Card Company 
This will be a Limited Edition. Only 1000 Signature Decks and Collector's Boxes will be printed
Each court card, Ace and Jokers will have original illustrations, capturing the feel of the era. 
The Cards will be printed on the "Legends" Classic Finish, which is the highest quality card stock.
The Tuck Case will be made with Premium Matte Card Stock Box, fully embossed and foiled, combined with Gold Metallic Ink.
Unique Back Design
Ace of Spades: Depicts the Model T Ford.
The Model T, also known as Tin Lizzie or just plain “T,” was one of the greatest innovations in transportation the world has ever known. Not only did its design build upon the achievements of the industry leaders, but it was accessible to the common man.
 King of Spades: Henry Ford
Because he created an automobile nearly any American could own, the Model T - which in 1922 were driven by half of all drivers in America, and the credit he is given for the popularity of the assembly line it has been said that Henry Ford “[put] the World on Wheels.”
Queen of Spades: Mary Anderson
Men laughed at Mary Anderson.They made fun of her and her silly little device.But in 1905 they stopped laughing when she was granted U.S. Patent No. 743,801 for her “window cleaning device for electric cars and other vehicles to remove snow, ice or sleet from the window.”Yes the windshield wiper was invented by a Southern Belle named Mary Anderson.
Jack of Spades: Karl Benz
Karl Benz, was a German engine designer and car engineer, generally regarded as the inventor of the first automobile powered by an internal combustion engine, and together with Bertha Benz, pioneering founder of the automobile manufacturer Mercedes-Benz.
 Ace of Spades: The Wright Flyer 1
The first flight, by Orville at 10:35 am, of 120 feet (37 m) in 12 seconds, at a speed of only 6.8 miles per hour (10.9 km/h) over the ground, was recorded in a famous photograph. The next two flights covered approximately 175 and 200 feet (53 and 61 m), by Wilbur and Orville respectively. Their altitude was about 10 feet (3.0 m) above the ground.
King of Diamonds: Wilbur Wright
Wilbur Wright was the oldest of the two Wright brothers, together invented the world's first successful airplane. The brothers successfully conducted the first free, controlled flight of a power-driven airplane on December 17, 1903.
Queen of Diamonds: Amelia Mary Earhart 
(July 24, 1897 – disappeared July 2, 1937) was an American aviation pioneer and author. Earhart was the first female aviator to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean. She received the U.S. Distinguished Flying Cross for this record. She set many other records, wrote best-selling books about her flying experiences and was instrumental in the formation of The Ninety-Nines, an organization for female pilots. 
Jack of Diamonds: Orville Wright
Orville Wright was the youngest of the two Wright brothers, together invented the world's first successful airplane. The brothers successfully conducted the first free, controlled flight of a power-driven airplane on December 17, 1903.
Ace of Clubs: The Light Bulb
In addressing the question of who invented the incandescent lamp, historians Robert Friedel and Paul Israel list 22 inventors of incandescent lamps prior to Joseph Swan and Thomas Edison. They conclude that Edison's version was able to outstrip the others because of a combination of three factors: an effective incandescent material, a higher vacuum than others were able to achieve (by use of the Sprengel pump) and a high resistance that made power distribution from a centralized source economically viable.
King of Clubs: Thomas Alva Edison 
Thomas Alva Edison was an American inventor and businessman. He developed many devices that greatly influenced life around the world, including the phonograph, the motion picture camera, and a long-lasting, practical electric light bulb. Dubbed "The Wizard of Menlo Park", he was one of the first inventors to apply the principles of mass production and large-scale teamwork to the process of invention, and because of that, he is often credited with the creation of the first industrial research laboratory.
Queen of Clubs: Ida Henrietta Hyde
The smallest functional unit of an organism is a cell.  And, though microscopic, there is valuable information hidden inside these small structures.  We cannot see that information with the naked eye.  But when a woman, who burrowed her way into the science arena, came up with a microscopic version of the electrode, it revolutionized neurophysiology and illuminated the possibility of research on a cellular level.  An electrode is an electrical conductor used to make contact with non-metallic surfaces.  The invention of a microelectrode, that could stimulate a living cell and record the electrical activity within the cell without damaging it, has changed the face of nerve and tissue understanding and research. 
Jack of Clubs: Nicola Tesla
Little did Duka Tesla know that her fourth of five children would harness the power of Niagra Falls, work for-and then against- Thomas Edison, create the A.C. induction motor that would be used all over the world in household (and industrial) appliances, conceive the polyphase alternating current system, win the “War of Currents” over Thomas Edison, and through his inventions “light” the entire planet we call earth. 
Ace of Hearts: The Invention of the Telephone
On June 2, 1875, Watson accidentally plucked one of the reeds and Bell (Alexander Graham Bell), at the receiving end of the wire, heard the overtones of the reed; overtones that would be necessary for transmitting speech. That demonstrated to Bell that only one reed or armature was necessary, not multiple reeds. This led to the "gallows" sound-powered telephone, which could transmit indistinct, voice-like sounds, but not clear speech.
 King of Hearts: Alexander Graham Bell
(March 3, 1847 – August 2, 1922)was an eminent Scottish-born scientist, inventor, engineer and innovator who is credited with inventing the first practical telephone.
 Queen of Hearts: Ada Lovelace
Augusta Ada Byron and now commonly known as Ada Lovelace, was an English mathematician and writer chiefly known for her work on Charles Babbage's early mechanical general-purpose computer, the Analytical Engine. Her notes on the engine include what is recognised as the first algorithm intended to be carried out by a machine. Because of this, she is often described as the world's first computer programmer.
Jack of Hearts: Samuel Morse
(April 27, 1791 – April 2, 1872) was an American painter and inventor. After having established his reputation as a portrait painter, in his middle age Morse contributed to the invention of a single-wire telegraph system based on European telegraphs. He was a co-developer of the Morse code, and helped to develop the commercial use of telegraphy.
How to add to your pledge:
1. After you have pledged to the project there will be a blue Manage your pledge button on the right hand column at the top of the page. 
2. Increase your pledge in the Pledge Amount box by the total of the add-ons you want to add. 
Unless you want to change your tier at the same time, Do not change the tier you are currently pledged at. If you do change your tier, just add the total of add-ons to your new tier level. (If you are a Canadian or international backer, please be sure to pledge the international amount that I have provided in the add-on section) 
3. Check your pledge and then hit the CONFIRM button
Important! Be sure to message me about your add-ons so I can be sure to mark it down! It creates a lot less confusion at the end.

Hey everyone!
I just wanted to give you a quick update. The Innovation Decks are almost here! I just received some samples, so I wanted to share them with all of you.
Also, please check out my next Kickstarter project that will be launching Tuesday next week. I have all of the images on the same page. Hope you all are excited!

Hello everyone! I am sorry it has been so long since my last update. The truth is, It's been a pretty busy summer and I've been meaning to update everyone for the last few weeks. I have a lot of news to cover, so I hope you're ready :)
The Innovation Playing Cards are on their way!
Ok, so my first bit of news is, the Innovation cards are finished and on their way. I just filled out the forms this week to have the decks released to the freight forwarder. The decks are now on the water headed towards Texas, where they will be shipped to all of you. Gambler's Warehouse will be handling all of the shipments this time. It was really fun shipping Golden Spike, but I feel my time can be used more effectively by using an experienced shipper. As of now the shipment should get to Texas by the first of September and they should be in your hands soon there after.

Hello everyone!
Closing Out BackKit Tomorrow at Noon
Just a reminder that if you have not done so please fill out your BackerKit. It is very important that you do that. Tomorrow at noon (my time CST), I will be closing out BackerKit and charging your cards. You will only see a charge if you have ordered additional items from BackerKit, not if you only filled out your information.
The Hard Proofs Are In!

Hello everyone!
I just want to give you all a quick update. The art for all of the decks has been digitally proofed. I have also paid the initial payment for production. We are now waiting for the Hard proofs, which is the last step before going to production. It looks like the projected ship date from Taiwan will be Mid-July, which will put them in the warehouse by Mid-August. as of right now, you should have your Innovation deck by the end of August.
BackerKit Pre-order will be closing soon!

468 backers have completed their surveys: 81%

campaign.story:
Delirium is an intricate but modern deck, strongly inspired by the classic french playing cards...with crazy twists.
Delirium Courts
Delirium is deigned by Thirdway Industries, Giovanni Meroni's new brand of playing cards. Delirium was chosen as the official 2015 deck of the United Cardists forum.
NEW! - Delirium Realm Book
The Delirium Realm book contains all characters of the Delirium World with a short (crazy) story. Is printed on the better stock available (170g) and have a supershiny mirrored cover. 
One book is FREE if your reward is 4 decks or more.
You can add extra books to your reward adding +7$.
Delirium Prism Tuck box
Delirium Prism is the version of the Delirium Deck that will be funded with the first goal of 8k. The tuck box will be printed by Expert Playing Card Co. on a special prismatic stock which changes color at every angle. The stock is very bright and matte, and won't affect colors much (it's not holographic).
This stock is new, never used for a deck tuck box before.
The color scheme for Delerium Prism uses acid green and blue as the main colours. The crazy scene on the front of the tuck box depicts the Delirium King giving a speech, surrounded by his guards and his consorts. On the back there is a scene with the Delirium Gods of War.
Here is the opened Delirium Prism Tuck Box. 
 A rendering of the Delirium Prism with JoD card (Delirium Heavy Infantry)
 Another view of two Delirium decks, front and back.
The prismatic effect on the Tuckbox is just photoshop, the final result of the prismatic effect will be different.
Delirium Cards
Delirium courts have a classic vibe but crazy expressions. Here are some courts, aces and jokers. The inspiration of this deck is just a simple burraco deck by Modiano. I put all the cards on my desk and said "let's redesign this, my way."
Master finish printed bt Expert Playing Card Co.
And some pips and the card back:
I named the AoS "Sultano"; the ace shape is made by his turban.
Stretch Goals
8,000 - DELIRIUM PRISM FUNDED! // REACHED!!
9000 - Embossing on Delirium Prism // REACHED!!
10,000 - Custom Seal on Delirium Prism // REACHED!!
11,000 - Inner tuckbox printing on Delirium Prism //REACHED!!
13,000 - 1th Extra Card on Delirium Prism (55 cards)
15,000 - DELIRIUM INSOMNIA UNLOCKED! - A new Delirium Deck of 55 cards. Will include embossing, inner printing, foil and seal.
17,000 - 2th Extra Card on Delirium Prism and Insomnia (+2 different cards! Both decks will have 56 cards)
21,000 - 3th Extra Card on Delirium Prism and Insomnia (+2 different cards! Both decks will have 57 cards)
25,000 - DELIRIUM MISTERY (?) UNLOCKED
38,000 - Giveaway!
If we reach 40K or more, other stretch goals will be unlocked!
Random stretch goals can be added during the campaign.
Stretch goals LV ups
Delirium deck will improve dramatically every stretch goal. This means every backer (you) will have an incentive to share it to make it better and better. 
The more stretch goal we reach, the better and more precious Delirium will be. Don't be shy and share it everywhere! :)
Are you a proud backer? You can change your profile image of Kickstarter with those funny round badges. 
 Uncut Sheet
Delirium Uncut frames are colorful and crazy. 
Will be shipped unframed and are not signed. Some minor damages on the edges may occour (are unavoidable and can be covered withthe frame).
Size: 57.3 x 61.3 cm ( 22.5 x 24.1 inch) - Displays 54 cards
Signature Edition /// Now AVAILABLE! ///
Delirium Signature Edition comes with a new, customized white tuck box.
 The back is ready to be signed and numbered. 
 I also want make the green part with the character inside like a bubble, with a special soft resin. I am not 100% sure I can do it, however. If the effect will be different than expected, I will find another way to custom it with something unique. /// Also, the limited will be improved by extras, based on the level of the backer. /// 
The Limited Edition costs 50$, shipping included, only 50/60 will be sold.
If you want to get one, verify there is the 5000$ Limited Edition reward available and add +50$ to your pledge.
Of course you DON'T have to pledge the 5000$ reward, this is just a placeholder.
/// One important thing: remember, when I'll send the final survey to know what yours reward(s) are, to write me you have a PRISM LIMITED EDITION, and if your level is at least 3, what court you want to customize and eventually what name you want printed on it. ///
Please, watch update #6 to see all the complete informations on Signature Edition.
Delirium Insomnia
At the 15k stretch goal, the Delirium Insomnia deck will be unlocked. It will have all the previous features unlocked on Prism (inner printing, emboss, custom seal and +1 extra card.)
Every "Insomnia" card will be different than "Prism". More features on "Insomnia" will be revealed during the campaign.
If Delirium Insomnia is unlocked you can change your rewards from pure "prism" into split "prism" + "insomnia".
The Delirium "Mystery" it's a special edition that will be revealed if we hit 25k (the name won't be Mystery)
Want to add some items to your pledge? Check the table!
Just add the amount indicated in the table below to your pledge!
One last thing
 Please, share this project with your friends! Like it on Facebook, follow on Twitter. We also have a Pinterest and Instagram account.
Thanks to the United Cardists forum and eveyone made this possible.
Tweaks and modifications will be done during the campaign.
Delirium Deck is designed by Giovanni Meroni, from Thirdway Industries.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The deck will be printed with Expert Playing Cards Co. 
It's a standard procedure and should go smoothly. I have already worked with them for my Evil Deck, coming early 2015.
They have already seen all the Delirium layouts and have approved them.

I am located in Italy, and I can't do the fulfillment directly: I'm using a professional fulfillment center located in the USA, Lake Michigan Mailers. They have already shipped a lot of Kickstarter decks and have a lot of experience in this field.

Of course problems might happen. I can't control other people actions, but I'll follow every step of the process to avoid problems and I will keep everyone updated.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
NOIR Arts Presents
DEFUNCTORUM Playing Cards
Defunctorum playing cards are an original set of two decks which consists of 54 fully customized playing cards each. Design of decks is created by Roman Kotiv and produced by NOIR Arts.
First deck “NOX Edition” is represented as night deck and another one “DIES Edition” - as day deck. Also we have an idea about additional decks for this set, but let it be mystery at the moment. 
Defunctorum playing cards design is complete, and another stuff will be announced soon. The only thing that we need now - is to get your support here on Kickstarter, which is essential for producing these playing cards. Our goal is to get sufficient amount of money, required for these playing cards to be printed and delivered to everyone interested. However the more we raise – more inspired we will become to bring you awesome add ons and bonuses!
Most of answers you can find in FAQ section. Please read it first.If you have any other questions - feel free to contact us.
Feedback on Defunctorum cards, written by MAX from Maxplayingcards. Check it here: http://goo.gl/w4p1MR
Defunctorum playing cards will be printed in Europe on special black core paper “Casino Classic” that is produced in Germany. campaign.story:
ARCANUM is an original set of playing cards designed by TDS and printed + produced by Gambler's Warehouse.
ARCANUM closely associated with the celebration which takes place on October 31, November 1 and November 2 in connection with the triduum of Hallowtide: All Hallows' Eve, Hallowmas and All Souls' Day. 
The holiday focuses on gatherings of family and friends to pray for and remember friends and family members who have died. ARCANUM connects living people, with the souls of dead. 
Each time we hold a deck of ARCANUM, we remember and pay tribute to the All Saints and souls of our native people. 
 Features:
Printed By USPCC
56 custom, beautifully designed Playing Cards
Casino Quality Playing Card Stock
Made in the USA
Custom Inner Tuck Box Design
Metallic Inks on Cards
Embossing & Gold Foiling on tucks
Card Backs

Custom Aces & Court Cards

Hello Backers,
Firstly just wanted to give you guys an update regarding Arcanum Printing Progress. 
I was at USPCC head office today and  viewed the proofs for Arcanum tucks and they look really good. Printing will begin 1st week of February on these decks & hopefully we will receive these by 2nd week of February. We just finally signed the contract with USPCC. There was an unexpected delay as there had to be some big changes made in the original artwork for the metallic inks purposes. It was originally done in CMYK by the artist but for metallic inks, the artwork had to be changed to RGB format.

We will continue to keep you updated as the project progresses!
